  • BUDGET 2023 LIKELY TO MAINTAIN PROPOSED TAX CUT FOR M40, TAX RISE FOR T20

    https://www.thesundaily.my/local/budget-2023-likely-to-maintain-proposed-tax-cut-for-m40-tax-rise-for-t20-FC10657417

    02/20/2023, 11:10

    64.71% Shortened!

    President Chow Chee Yen said the purpose of the tax reduction is to help the M40 with the rising cost of living and increase their disposable income, while the tax increase on the T20 is to alleviate the reduction in revenue collection caused by the tax cut

    “As such, I would expect the respective tax cut of two ppt and tax increase of 0.5 ppt to be maintained,” he told Bernama via email recently

    Under Budget 2023 tabled on Oct 7, 2022, by the former government, the income tax for the chargeable income band of between RM50,001 to RM100,000 was reduced by two ppt for the year of assessment 2023 -- from 13 per cent to 11 per cent for the RM50,001-RM70,000 band, and from 21 per cent to 19 per cent for the RM70,001-RM100,000 band

    Former prime minister Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob’s administration also raised the tax for those in the chargeable income bracket of between RM250,001 and RM400,000 from 24.5 per cent to 25 per cent

    Meanwhile, he said the return of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) would not be on the cards as Anwar has recently stated that the government would not introduce the broad-based consumption tax

    “GST is not the priority of the current government in this upcoming budget because, being a broad-based consumption tax, GST would also impact the low and middle-income households

    ['tax', 'budget', 'government', 'income', 'would']

    President Chow Chee Yen said the purpose of the tax reduction is to help the M40 with the rising cost of living and increase their disposable income, while the tax increase on the T20 is to alleviate the reduction in revenue collection caused by the tax cut

    “As such, I would expect the respective tax cut of two ppt and tax increase of 0.5 ppt to be maintained,” he told Bernama via email recently

    Under Budget 2023 tabled on Oct 7, 2022, by the former government, the income tax for the chargeable income band of between RM50,001 to RM100,000 was reduced by two ppt for the year of assessment 2023 -- from 13 per cent to 11 per cent for the RM50,001-RM70,000 band, and from 21 per cent to 19 per cent for the RM70,001-RM100,000 band

    Former prime minister Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob’s administration also raised the tax for those in the chargeable income bracket of between RM250,001 and RM400,000 from 24.5 per cent to 25 per cent

    Meanwhile, he said the return of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) would not be on the cards as Anwar has recently stated that the government would not introduce the broad-based consumption tax

    “GST is not the priority of the current government in this upcoming budget because, being a broad-based consumption tax, GST would also impact the low and middle-income households

    ['tax', 'budget', 'government', 'income', 'would']



  • AT LEAST 41,020 DEAD FROM POWERFUL TWIN EARTHQUAKES IN SOUTHERN TURKIYE

    https://www.thesundaily.my/world/at-least-41020-dead-from-powerful-twin-earthquakes-in-southern-turkiye-GC10657537

    02/20/2023, 11:10

    53.85% Shortened!

    According to Turkish Disaster and Emergency Management Presidency (AFAD), a total of 19,436 local and international search and rescue personnel are currently working in the field

    Search and rescue efforts have been completed in the earthquake zone except in Kahramanmaras and Hatay provinces, Yunus Sezer, the head of AFAD, told reporters

    Sezer said search and rescue efforts continued in nearly 40 buildings, while over 6,000 containers have been set up

    Noting that evacuations from the earthquake zone to other provinces are continuing, he said that over 460,900 people have so far been evacuated

    “We continue to house more than 1 million disaster victims in the region in tent cities, container cities and public guesthouses.” Sezer said that cash aid of 10,000 Turkish liras (US$531) has been given to nearly 800,000 citizens

    Speaking to reporters in Gaziantep province, Environment, Urbanisation and Climate Change Minister Murat Kurum said inspections at 927,000 buildings consisting of 3,520,000 independent sections in the earthquake zone had been completed

    ['earthquake', 'country', 'disaster', 'say', 'province']

    Sezer said search and rescue efforts continued in nearly 40 buildings, while over 6,000 containers have been set up

    Noting that evacuations from the earthquake zone to other provinces are continuing, he said that over 460,900 people have so far been evacuated

    “We continue to house more than 1 million disaster victims in the region in tent cities, container cities and public guesthouses.” Sezer said that cash aid of 10,000 Turkish liras (US$531) has been given to nearly 800,000 citizens

  • SINGAPORE TO TAX LUXURY CARS UP TO 100% MORE – BMW 7 SERIES PRICE UP RM142K, ASTON DBX UP RM636K! - PAULTAN.ORG

    https://paultan.org/2023/02/20/singapore-to-tax-luxury-cars-up-to-100-more-bmw-7-series-price-up-rm142k-aston-dbx-up-rm636k/

    02/20/2023

    56.25% Shortened!

    Seems like my dream car is getting further away

    For EVs such as the Tesla Model 3 AWD Performance (OMV S$73,984, or RM245,277) is expected to see an ARF hike of almost S$16,000 (RM53,044)

    Moving up the luxury ladder, the Audi A8 (OMV S$79,392, or RM263,215) gets an ARF hike of almost S$20,000 (RM66,307), while the BMW 7 Series (OMV S$103,000, or RM341,485) gets an ARF hike of more than S$40,000 (RM132,615)

    Of course, the OMV is only part of the story of vehicle pricing, and for Singapore, the other significant component in a vehicle’s price tag is the COE or certificate of entitlement, which is a sum paid to the city-state’s land transport authority in order to register a car for road use, and is essentially a quota system to regulate the number of vehicle’s on the country’s roads

    In the top COE tier, Category E or the open category, the quota premium is currently S$105,002 (RM348,219)

    These adjustments come as part of the Singapore government’s wider efforts toward implementing a “progressive vehicle tax system” for the country’s car market, according to SG Car Mart

    max 1 car registered per person rich is still rich, no matter how much goment tax

    ['car', 'february', 'singapore', 'arf', 'vehicle']

    Of course, the OMV is only part of the story of vehicle pricing, and for Singapore, the other significant component in a vehicle’s price tag is the COE or certificate of entitlement, which is a sum paid to the city-state’s land transport authority in order to register a car for road use, and is essentially a quota system to regulate the number of vehicle’s on the country’s roads

    In the top COE tier, Category E or the open category, the quota premium is currently S$105,002 (RM348,219)

    These adjustments come as part of the Singapore government’s wider efforts toward implementing a “progressive vehicle tax system” for the country’s car market, according to SG Car Mart

    In Munich, Blinken and Wang Yi clashed over Washington's shooting down of a Chinese balloon over its airspace

    He also warned Wang "about the implications and consequences if China provides material support to Russia or assistance with systemic sanctions evasion", Price said

    In turn, Wang Yi told Blinken that their countries' relations had been damaged by how Washington reacted to the balloon, which China has repeatedly described as a civilian craft for weather research that veered off course

    02/20/2023, 10:10

    50.0% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise BANGI, Feb 20 — A group of students that were caught on video vandalising school equipment has been called for counselling to understand the motives of their actions, Education Minister Fadhlina Sidek said today

    The minister also urged the public to stop spreading the video to protect the students’ identities and ensure an effective counselling process

    “We have finished the investigation process which involved their parents and implemented the intervention process

    She was referring to a group of local students who were shown in a viral video vandalising school equipment to celebrate the end of the school term

    “I cannot reveal [their identities] due to integrity, we need to protect the faces of the students and the school to make sure they can receive continuous counselling

    The minister also urges the public to not “give up” on this group of students and believes there are issues behind them that need to be addressed

    ['group', 'student', 'video', 'school', 'counsel']

  • ADVOCATES TELL PAS REP LINKING FOOD QUALITY TO AUTISM IRRESPONSIBLE, GIVES WRONG IMPRESSION

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/20/advocates-tell-pas-rep-linking-food-quality-to-autism-irresponsible-gives-wrong-impression/55787

    02/20/2023, 10:08

    62.5% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 20 — The Autism Inclusiveness Direct Action Group (Aida) today condemned Kapar MP Dr Halimah Ali over her remarks linking poor nutrition to cause autism

    “Her statement gives a wrong impression to the public, further causing immense stigma and belief that autism is caused by poor care and determined by your level of income,” Aida said in a statement

    Aida also said that the group is ready to participate in meaningful dialogues to alleviate any stigma against the autism community

    “We strongly urge that policymakers and those in the authority of medical care and its allied practitioners, be mindful, and responsible with how they speak of autism,” said Aida

    Similarly, the Autistic peer support group, Autism Initiatives Malaysia also condemned Dr Halimah over her remarks

    “Having an MP who is a trained medical doctor stating ‘low-quality’ foods to be a cause for autism is appalling as there is no science behind it

    ['autism', 'group', 'aida', 'halimah', 'remark']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 20 — The Autism Inclusiveness Direct Action Group (Aida) today condemned Kapar MP Dr Halimah Ali over her remarks linking poor nutrition to cause autism

    Aida also said that the group is ready to participate in meaningful dialogues to alleviate any stigma against the autism community

    “We strongly urge that policymakers and those in the authority of medical care and its allied practitioners, be mindful, and responsible with how they speak of autism,” said Aida

    72.73% Shortened!

    Liverpool have struggled under Jurgen Klopp in the Premier League this season with Brazilian midfielder Fabinho having suggested three players that the Reds have missed the most Liverpool star Fabinho has revealed who the club’s three dressing room leaders are, whilst also detailing which player the Reds have missed the most in what has been a stuttering campaign

    However, Fabinho has suggested that the absence of Virgil van Dijk contributed hugely

    The Dutch defender missed three matches with a hamstring injury before making his return in the win over Newcastle - something that has hugely boosted Liverpool according to his Brazilian teammate

    Yes, I’m very happy to have him back and playing at this level.” Liverpool will be aiming to continue their promising form over the next week

    Fabinho himself will be aiming to get his own form back to its previous heights

    Of Fabinho’s 20 Premier League appearances this season, 16 of them have been starts

  • CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS AT RISK OF MENTAL HEALTH DISORDERS, SAYS DR ZALIHA

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/20/children-adolescents-at-risk-of-mental-health-disorders-says-dr-zaliha

    02/20/2023, 09:10

    62.5% Shortened!

    Monday, 20 Feb 2023

    They are stuck in their problems and do not have enough knowledge to solve them," she said during the opening ceremony of the Child and Adolescent psychiatric ward at Permai Hospital here, Sunday (Feb 19)

    "Before the Covid-19 pandemic, the World Health Organisation (WHO) estimated that 10 to 20 per cent of children and teens around the world experienced mental health disorders while 50 per cent of serious mental health problems are established by age 14," said Dr Zaliha

    She also urged healthcare personnel to equip themselves with the knowledge of Psychological First Aid to help children and adolescents in the event of a tragedy in the country

    Meanwhile, Dr Zaliha said the psychiatric ward for children and adolescents at Permai Hospital's Iris Complex, which is the first of its kind in Malaysia, started its operations last month

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['child', 'adolescent', 'mental', 'health', 'say']

    Monday, 20 Feb 2023

    They are stuck in their problems and do not have enough knowledge to solve them," she said during the opening ceremony of the Child and Adolescent psychiatric ward at Permai Hospital here, Sunday (Feb 19)

    "Before the Covid-19 pandemic, the World Health Organisation (WHO) estimated that 10 to 20 per cent of children and teens around the world experienced mental health disorders while 50 per cent of serious mental health problems are established by age 14," said Dr Zaliha

    She also urged healthcare personnel to equip themselves with the knowledge of Psychological First Aid to help children and adolescents in the event of a tragedy in the country

    Meanwhile, Dr Zaliha said the psychiatric ward for children and adolescents at Permai Hospital's Iris Complex, which is the first of its kind in Malaysia, started its operations last month

  • ANIMAL DROPPINGS POLLUTING RIVER IN MELAKA

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/20/animal-droppings-polluting-river-in-melaka

    02/20/2023, 09:09

    53.85% Shortened!

    Melaka housing, local government and environment committee chairman Datuk Zaidi Attan said an initial investigation by the state Environment Department (DOE) found that cow and goat droppings from a nearby farm had polluted the river

    The department will work closely with the state’s Veterinary Services Department to determine if the animal waste had been released into the river according to the standard operating procedure, he added

    “The DOE will further investigate whether the livestock waste or the operation of the retention pond in the farming site conforms to specifications,” he said

    Lim said Sungai Lereh pollution was not new to residents, who claimed that it happens a few times a year.He said he had requested the DOE to conduct regular monitoring along the river because there were agricultural activities in the area, which require a clean water source

    Recently, residents living nearby complained about a stench from the river due to pollution

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['sungai', 'lereh', 'pollution', 'take', 'resident']

    Melaka housing, local government and environment committee chairman Datuk Zaidi Attan said an initial investigation by the state Environment Department (DOE) found that cow and goat droppings from a nearby farm had polluted the river

    The department will work closely with the state’s Veterinary Services Department to determine if the animal waste had been released into the river according to the standard operating procedure, he added

    “The DOE will further investigate whether the livestock waste or the operation of the retention pond in the farming site conforms to specifications,” he said

    Lim said Sungai Lereh pollution was not new to residents, who claimed that it happens a few times a year.He said he had requested the DOE to conduct regular monitoring along the river because there were agricultural activities in the area, which require a clean water source

    Recently, residents living nearby complained about a stench from the river due to pollution

    02/20/2023, 09:08

    60.0% Shortened!

    The 60-year-old victim, Laini Sukat (pic), had previously told her family of her intention to donate her organs when she died

    After she succumbed to her injuries following an accident in Ranau district last month, her family conveyed her wish to hospital staff, who then arranged for the transplant

    “We wish to thank the donor and her family for allowing us to do this, and for giving such a great gift to two people in need

    “Fill up a form via MySejahtera and tell your family members about it, if you wish to become an organ donor,” she said

    Jude Bellingham can't be the only midfield transfer target for Liverpool in the summer

    Liverpool went into the campaign with an aging midfield and as a host of those midfield options have expiring contracts at the end of the season, there is going to have to be some shifting around for the club's recruitment team

    He is simply the future of the club, and Liverpool needs more players of his age and profile

    Liverpool simply needs more than just one midfield transfer this summer

    And that means Liverpool will need to be looking at a cheaper alternative in order to make sure Klopp has the midfield depth he needs heading into next season

    Liverpool may be a huge leap, but he may not necessarily be an immediate option for the starting XI, rather just a squad player, and for that purpose, for the kind of money he is available, he could be a bargain option

    64.71% Shortened!

    The team’s semi-final target fizzled out after going down 2-3 to defending champions China at the Dubai Exhibition Centre, in the United Arab Emirates (UAE) on Friday

    Reigning world champions Aaron Chia-Soh Wooi Yik won the quarter-final match against India while independent shuttlers Ong Yew Sin-Teo Ee Yi went down fighting in the semi-finals against China

    “We did not reach our target but this championship is part of our preparations for the Sudirman Cup in May,” said Rexy

    Malaysia did not qualify on merit for the world mixed team event after the quarters exit but they will still get to compete based on world team rankings, as they are currently ranked fifth

    “It is also good to see that they have a strong team spirit, be it on or off the court.”

  • META LAUNCHES SUBSCRIPTION SERVICE FOR FACEBOOK AND INSTAGRAM

    https://www.theedgemarkets.com/node/655865

    02/20/2023, 07:08

    68.42% Shortened!

    In addition to a verification badge, the subscription includes “proactive account protection, access to account support, and increased visibility and reach,” a Meta spokesperson said in an email

    is also pushing a subscription offering right now, with account verification being a major selling point

    Twitter’s subscription offering has been slow to take off

    Perhaps the most valuable aspect of Meta’s subscription package will be “increased visibility.” Standing out on Facebook or Instagram is more difficult these days, even among a user’s own followers

    Unlike Twitter, which does not verify a user’s identity through the subscription, Meta will require users to confirm their identity with a government ID to receive a verification badge

    Meta is testing the subscription product first in Australia and New Zealand, starting later this week

    ['search', 'content', 'company', 'meta', 'subscription']

    MSCI China tracks more than 700 China stocks listed globally, including Tencent, BYD and Industrial and Commercial Bank of China

    Goldman Sachs in July cut its earnings outlook for the index to zero growth

    Goldman Sachs expects China's economy to grow by 5.5% in full-year 2023, powered by second- and third-quarter growth that it now puts at 9% and 7%, respectively

  • MARK ZUCKERBERG WANTS TO CHARGE OVER RM60/MONTH FOR VERIFIED BLUE TICK ON FACEBOOK AND INSTAGRAM

    https://soyacincau.com/2023/02/20/mark-zuckerberg-meta-verified-blue-tick-facebook-instagram-tackle-scam-accounts/

    02/20/2023

    64.71% Shortened!

    According to Zuckerberg, the subscription service will allow you to verify your account with a government ID, get a blue badge, get extra impersonation protection against imposter accounts and have direct access to customer support

    The Verge reports that the Meta Verified service will be rolling out in Australia this week with a monthly subscription of AUD 19.99 (about RM60.87) on the web and AUD 24.99 (about RM76.09) on mobile

    Besides having the verified badge to prove that an account is authentic, Mark Zuckerberg emphasised that customer support is a big part of the value of Meta Verified subscription

    Some have accused Meta of trying to gain extra profit over a necessary feature and users shouldn’t be made to pay a monthly subscription fee for customer service

    Meta has been plagued with scam ads on its platform and it fails to take action in a timely manner

    Should customer service and action against scams be allowed to be a paid feature? Can Facebook ensure that they won’t approve a Meta Verified subscription from a scammer? Let us know in the comments below.

    ['meta', 'verify', 'service', 'subscription', 'account']

  • UKRAINE'S ZELENSKIY: RUSSIA HIT BY "EXTRAORDINARILY SIGNIFICANT" LOSSES IN EAST

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/world/2023/02/20/ukraine039s-zelenskiy---russia-suffering-extraordinarily-significant-losses-in-east

    02/20/2023, 05:10

    62.5% Shortened!

    We are breaking down the invaders and inflicting extraordinarily significant losses on Russia," Zelenskiy said in his nightly video address

    Zelenskiy referred to several towns in Donbas, where fighting has been focused for months, saying "the more losses Russia suffers there, in Donbas - in Bakhmut, Vuhledar, Marinka, Kreminna - the faster we will be able to end this war with Ukraine's victory"

    Zelenskiy outlined the state of defense in other sectors after what he described as an "extended" meeting of the military command

    "Of course, military issues and intelligence details are not something you can share with everyone," Zelenskiy said

    And a sense that Ukraine is moving towards its goals." (Reporting by Ron Popeski and Nick Starkov; editing by Diane Craft and Richard Chang)

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['zelenskiy', 'ukraine', 'military', 'loss', 'russian']

    We are breaking down the invaders and inflicting extraordinarily significant losses on Russia," Zelenskiy said in his nightly video address

    Zelenskiy referred to several towns in Donbas, where fighting has been focused for months, saying "the more losses Russia suffers there, in Donbas - in Bakhmut, Vuhledar, Marinka, Kreminna - the faster we will be able to end this war with Ukraine's victory"

    Zelenskiy outlined the state of defense in other sectors after what he described as an "extended" meeting of the military command

    "Of course, military issues and intelligence details are not something you can share with everyone," Zelenskiy said

    And a sense that Ukraine is moving towards its goals." (Reporting by Ron Popeski and Nick Starkov; editing by Diane Craft and Richard Chang)

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['zelenskiy', 'ukraine', 'military', 'loss', 'russian']

  • RELIGIOUS AFFAIRS MINISTER: ORGANISERS OF PAS YOUTH GATHERING ERRED IN NOT SHOWING PEACEFUL SIDE OF ISLAM

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/19/religious-affairs-minister-organisers-of-pas-youth-gathering-erred-in-not-showing-peaceful-side-of-islam/55722

    02/20/2023, 01:08

    57.14% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 19 — Minister in the Prime Minister’s Department (Religious Affairs) Datuk Mohd Na’im Mokhtar called out the organisers of a PAS Youth parade in Terengganu for being callous with their choice of outfits and portrayal of Islam

    He said by choosing to use Islamic symbols, their parade had caused members of the public to raise their concerns that the parade could cause racial disharmony

    “In my opinion, to march in that manner was wrong and gives people a bad impression of the country and Islam

    It’s best the organisers highlight the peaceful and harmonious side of Islam that will strengthen our unity

    This came on the heels of reports that Terengganu police would be speaking to Terengganu PAS Youth, who were the organiser of the event

    PAS Youth had organised a gathering called Perhimpunan Pemuda Islam Terengganu (Himpit) over two days on February 17 and 18 in Bari Indah Beach Resort in Setiu

    ['organiser', 'pa', 'youth', 'parade', 'terengganu']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 19 — Minister in the Prime Minister’s Department (Religious Affairs) Datuk Mohd Na’im Mokhtar called out the organisers of a PAS Youth parade in Terengganu for being callous with their choice of outfits and portrayal of Islam

    He said by choosing to use Islamic symbols, their parade had caused members of the public to raise their concerns that the parade could cause racial disharmony

  • LIVERPOOL TRANSFER NEWS: PIOTR ZIELINSKI LOOKS SET TO LEAVE NAPOLI, REDS ARE KEEN TO GET HIM – JOURNALIST

    https://www.rousingthekop.com/2023/02/20/liverpool-transfer-news-piotr-zielinski-looks-set-to-leave-napoli-reds-are-keen-to-get-him-journalist/

    02/20/2023

    45.45% Shortened!

    Liverpool are interested in signing Napoli midfielder Piotr Zielinski this summer, according to journalist Rudy Galetti

    “As well as Amrabat, who was courted by Barcelona in this winter transfer season, [Liverpool are also looking at] Merino of Real Sociedad and Zielinski, whose contract will expire in June 2024 and will most likely leave Napoli at the end of the season,” Galetti said

    Liverpool have been long-term admirers of Zielinski, as the club even made a bid to sign in from Udinese back in 2016

    As demonstrated regularly this season, Liverpool need runners – players who are going to win the ball in the middle of the park

    However, now at 28-years-old, he would only add to Liverpool’s aging squad

    Therefore, whilst he is obviously dominating for Serie A league leaders Napoli this season, this is an unlikely transfer to be made this summer.

    ['liverpool', 'napoli', 'zielinski', 'summer', 'season']

  • SOCCER-ARSENAL EDGE AHEAD AGAIN IN TITLE RACE AS MAN UNITED JOIN THE PARTY

    https://www.thestar.com.my/sport/football/2023/02/20/soccer-arsenal-edge-ahead-again-in-title-race-as-man-united-join-the-party

    02/20/2023

    76.0% Shortened!

    And to make City's title defence all the more difficult, rivals Manchester United are not going away either

    This time of year is often where a Pep Guardiola-led City side normally slide to top gear

    In 2018-19 and 2020-21, 15 game winning streaks in each season, which began mid-campaign, helped steer City onto league title glory

    Against leaders Arsenal last Wednesday, City looked back to their best as they ran out 3-1 winners to leap-frog the Gunners -- a performance that left their title rivals fearing the worst

    City and Liverpool had been streets ahead of the rest of the field last term and were expected to do battle, unopposed, for this season's crown

    New coach Erik ten Hag, however, has transformed the club, with the 3-0 win over Leicester City on Sunday, their eighth victory in their last 11 league games, moved them five points behind Arsenal in third, having played one game more

    ['league', 'arsenal', 'city', 'last', 'title']

  • KLOPP BACKS KARIUS AHEAD OF LEAGUE CUP FINAL DESPITE CHAMPIONS LEAGUE NIGHTMARE

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/sports/2023/02/20/klopp-backs-karius-ahead-of-league-cup-final-despite-champions-league-nightmare/55771

    02/20/2023

    64.71% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise NEWCASTLE, Feb 20 — Loris Karius was backed by Jurgen Klopp to put his 2018 Champions League final nightmare behind him should Newcastle select the German goalkeeper for their English League Cup final against Manchester United

    Karius, 29, joined Newcastle on a short-term contract in September but has yet to make his debut for the northeast club

    Back-up Martin Dubravka is cup-tied after already appearing for Manchester United in this season’s League Cup

    Klopp, speaking after Sunday’s match, was asked if Karius had the mentality to handle another appearance in a final

    “I have no doubt about that,” said Klopp

    “He’s a great goalie, that’s why Newcastle signed him.” Newcastle manager Eddie Howe said Karius’ involvement in major matches had been a key factor in the decision to bring him to St James’ Park

    ['newcastle', 'karius', 'klopp', 'league', 'final']

    Potter has only been Chelsea boss for five months since replacing Thomas Tuchel in September

    Mourinho has been tipped as a possible replacement should Todd Boehly finally lose patience with Potter and the Roma boss has already made his thoughts on managing the club for a third time clear

    “The club reached such a level that it doesn't matter who it is with, but Chelsea will always be Chelsea

    Chelsea will always be big and my house will always be 200 metres away from the stadium so I want to keep listening to the sound of happiness and success

    "Jose Mourinho is a former Chelsea manager who is enormously popular with the crowd, he's the most successful individual the club have ever employed,” Keys said

    66.67% Shortened!

    The gauge climbed as much as 1.6% in Monday’s (Feb 20) session amid a broad rebound in China

    Escalating geopolitical tensions and an uncertain outlook for the economic recovery have sparked losses in February after a three-month surge, though China bulls say a key political meeting due next month as well as upcoming earnings will bring fresh impetus

    Chinese equity gauges were the best performers in Asia on Monday

    A gauge of Chinese stocks in Hong Kong advanced more than 1.5%, after entering a technical correction last week

    Meantime, overseas funds returned to selling China’s bonds in January after a one-month pause

    That’s also the biggest outflow since May

  • MALAYSIA TO REBOUND STRONGLY WITH PROGRESSIVE ECONOMIC FACTOR

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2023/02/20/malaysia-to-rebound-strongly-with-progressive-economic-factor

    02/20/2023

    53.85% Shortened!

    Principal Malaysia chief executive officer and country head Munirah Khairuddin said the past three years have seen many changes to the global landscape, including geopolitical tensions, changing world governments and volatile financial markets that caused financial distress to many, and Malaysians were not spared

    “While we are optimistic of the economic growth, we remain cautious over existing global conflicts and the probability of escalation such as in the Russia-Ukraine war as well as inflation rate in the country,” she said in an interview with Bernama

    She added that while recession fears are still looming, the worst is over for many as the majority of markets have shown strong signs of economic rebound, driven by China’s economic reopening after a long closure due to its zero-Covid policy

    “Opportunities await in Asia, particularly within the renewables and tourism sectors, so long as the country continues to empower the small and medium enterprise and business sector to attract more foreign direct investments (FDIs)

    “While Malaysia will continue to experience a volatile market especially for equities due to global circumstances, it will continue to gain traction as the market has been undervalued,” she said

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['economic', 'growth', 'global', 'well', 'country']

    Principal Malaysia chief executive officer and country head Munirah Khairuddin said the past three years have seen many changes to the global landscape, including geopolitical tensions, changing world governments and volatile financial markets that caused financial distress to many, and Malaysians were not spared

    “While we are optimistic of the economic growth, we remain cautious over existing global conflicts and the probability of escalation such as in the Russia-Ukraine war as well as inflation rate in the country,” she said in an interview with Bernama

    She added that while recession fears are still looming, the worst is over for many as the majority of markets have shown strong signs of economic rebound, driven by China’s economic reopening after a long closure due to its zero-Covid policy

  • MRCB NET PROFIT RISES TO RM64.85MIL IN FY22

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2023/02/20/mrcb-net-profit-rises-to-rm6485mil-in-fy22

    02/20/2023

    68.42% Shortened!

    In a filing to Bursa Malaysia today, the company said the strong recovery in revenue was mainly due to more normalised operations after two years of COVID-19-related disruptions, which resulted in increased revenue recognition from higher construction progress across both the engineering, construction and environment (ECE) division as well as the property development and investment division, and a recovery in overall property sales

    "In addition to the contribution from SULSB to the ECE division, higher operating profits were also derived from the property development and investment division in 2022, as a result of much better construction progress and sales from the division’s completed unsold inventory and sales of units from ongoing property development projects under construction

    Moving forward, MRCB said its major source of revenue and operating profits would come from property development and investment as well as the ECE divisions

    As at Dec 31, 2022, the property development and investment division retained its higher sales trajectory and sold RM487.9 million worth of properties from its completed and ongoing developments

    The division has cumulative unbilled sales of RM536.5 million, which will be recognised progressively over the construction period of the development projects,” it shared

    As for property development and investment, MRCB said the division will continue to earn a relatively stable income stream from its remaining investment property from Celcom Tower and its stake in Sentral REIT

    ['million', 'construction', 'division', 'property', 'development']

    In a filing to Bursa Malaysia today, the company said the strong recovery in revenue was mainly due to more normalised operations after two years of COVID-19-related disruptions, which resulted in increased revenue recognition from higher construction progress across both the engineering, construction and environment (ECE) division as well as the property development and investment division, and a recovery in overall property sales

    "In addition to the contribution from SULSB to the ECE division, higher operating profits were also derived from the property development and investment division in 2022, as a result of much better construction progress and sales from the division’s completed unsold inventory and sales of units from ongoing property development projects under construction

    Moving forward, MRCB said its major source of revenue and operating profits would come from property development and investment as well as the ECE divisions

    As at Dec 31, 2022, the property development and investment division retained its higher sales trajectory and sold RM487.9 million worth of properties from its completed and ongoing developments

    The division has cumulative unbilled sales of RM536.5 million, which will be recognised progressively over the construction period of the development projects,” it shared

    As for property development and investment, MRCB said the division will continue to earn a relatively stable income stream from its remaining investment property from Celcom Tower and its stake in Sentral REIT

  • UNIFI MOBILE ULTIMATE POSTPAID SUBSCRIBERS WILL NO LONGER ENJOY 5G STARTING MARCH 2023

    https://soyacincau.com/2023/02/20/unifi-mobile-ultimate-postpaid-subscribers-will-no-longer-get-5g-starting-march-2023/

    02/20/2023

    45.45% Shortened!

    Following the introduction of the new Uni5G postpaid plans, Telekom Malaysia will stop offering free 5G access for its older Unifi Mobile Ultimate plan

    As pointed out by @aniq8676, users on the current Ultimate Postpaid plan are told to switch to the newer Uni5G plan in order to enjoy 5G services

    At the moment, these subscribers can enjoy 5G as they were given a free unlimited 5G data pass as part of the 5G trial period

    We’ve reached out to Telekom Malaysia, and they have confirmed that existing Unifi Mobile Ultimate Plan customers can continue to use the free unlimited 5G pass until the end of February 2023

    Starting from March 2023, they encourage customers on their 4G-only Ultimate plan to change to the latest Uni5G Postpaid 89 to enjoy unlimited 5G and 4G data

    These devices are tied to a 24-month contract period

    ['uni5g', 'postpaid', 'plan', 'ultimate', 'offer']

  • N.KOREA FIRES BALLISTIC MISSILES, WARNS OF TURNING PACIFIC INTO ‘FIRING RANGE’

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/world/2023/02/20/nkorea-fires-ballistic-missiles-warns-of-turning-pacific-into-firing-range/55776

    02/20/2023

    73.91% Shortened!

    The launches come just two days after North Korea fired an intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) into the sea off Japan’s west coast, prompting the United States to hold joint air exercises with South Korea and separately with Japan on Sunday

    South Korea’s Joint Chiefs of Staff strongly condemned the launches as a “grave provocation” that should be ceased immediately

    “Our government has made it clear that North Korea’s provocations will definitely come at a price

    “Tension on the peninsula is likely to reach its peak in coming months as North Korea is accelerating its military actions with higher frequency, and her statement indicates that it would continue impromptu missile tests using the Pacific as its shooting range,” said Yang Moo-jin, a professor at the University of North Korean Studies in Seoul

    Park Won-gon, a professor at Ewha Womans University in Seoul, said Monday’s missile launch and statement are in line with the North Korean foreign ministry’s recent threat to take “unprecedentedly persistent, strong” responses to the allies’ joint military drills

    “North Korea seems to be trying to reinforce its nuclear capability by raising issue over the drills,” Park said

    ['north', 'korea', 'fire', 'missile', 'say']

    The launches come just two days after North Korea fired an intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) into the sea off Japan’s west coast, prompting the United States to hold joint air exercises with South Korea and separately with Japan on Sunday

    “Our government has made it clear that North Korea’s provocations will definitely come at a price

  • SIVAKUMAR: COST OF HIRING OF INDONESIAN DOMESTIC WORKERS TO BE REVIEWED

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/20/sivakumar-cost-of-hiring-of-indonesian-domestic-workers-to-be-reviewed/55911

    02/20/2023

    45.45% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise JAKARTA, Feb 20 — Malaysia and Indonesia will review the cost of hiring domestic Indonesian workers at a more reasonable rate, says Human Resources Minister V

    He said the reduction in the cost of recruitment would be discussed at the two-day Joint Working Group Meeting in Yogjakarta beginning Wednesday

    We want to see if we can find an amicable solution and if the cost could be reduced,” he said

    Sivakumar said he hoped the cost could be brought down to under RM9,000 compared to the RM12,000 decided in the last meeting in November 2022, inclusive of the quarantine cost of RM3,000

    “To have zero cost is impossible because there are costs involved including in Malaysia, but we look at what is the best mechanism to reduce the cost,” he told Malaysian media after holding a meeting with his Indonesian counterpart, Dr Ida Fauziyah

    Of the total, 63,323 work as domestic workers, and Indonesians represent the largest number in the sector in Malaysia

    ['malaysia', 'cost', 'domestic', 'indonesian', 'worker']

    About Us Advertise JAKARTA, Feb 20 — Malaysia and Indonesia will review the cost of hiring domestic Indonesian workers at a more reasonable rate, says Human Resources Minister V

    He said the reduction in the cost of recruitment would be discussed at the two-day Joint Working Group Meeting in Yogjakarta beginning Wednesday

    We want to see if we can find an amicable solution and if the cost could be reduced,” he said

    Sivakumar said he hoped the cost could be brought down to under RM9,000 compared to the RM12,000 decided in the last meeting in November 2022, inclusive of the quarantine cost of RM3,000

    “To have zero cost is impossible because there are costs involved including in Malaysia, but we look at what is the best mechanism to reduce the cost,” he told Malaysian media after holding a meeting with his Indonesian counterpart, Dr Ida Fauziyah

    Of the total, 63,323 work as domestic workers, and Indonesians represent the largest number in the sector in Malaysia

    ['malaysia', 'cost', 'domestic', 'indonesian', 'worker']

    02/20/2023

    Bánh mì (pronounced 'bun mee') is a popular Vietnamese variety of sandwiches that share the same core ingredient a baguette

    According to the site, Bánh mì (pronounced 'bun mee') is a popular Vietnamese variety of sandwich that shares the same core ingredient of a baguette

    The street food is considered the best, tasty and affordable food in the morning for almost all of the people in the country

    Japanese kaarage ranked sixth

    Other street foods that made the top 10 ranked by TasteAtlas including peirogi (8th), a stuffed dumpling from Poland, and esquites (9th), a Mexican street food that is typically consumed as a snack on the go

    TasteAtlas is considered one of the world's most prestigious traditional culinary experience travel guide websites, with a catalog of more than 10,000 types of food and drink from around the world

    ['baguette', 'vietnam', 'tasteatlas', 'dish', 'world']

  • EASY DECISION ON CITIZENSHIP LAW, WORK DONE DURING PERIKATAN’S TIME, SAYS FORMER DEPUTY MINISTER MAS ERMIEYATI

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/20/easy-decision-on-citizenship-law-work-done-during-perikatans-time-says-former-deputy-minister-mas-ermieyati/55844

    02/20/2023

    60.0% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 20 — The government of the day had it easy with the decision to update current laws to confer automatic citizenship to the offspring of Malaysian women who give birth overseas, Datuk Mas Ermieyati Samsudin said

    According to the former deputy minister in the Prime Minister’s Department under Parliament and Law, when she was in office she had met these families and brought them to meet former de facto law minister Datuk Seri Wan Junaidi Tuanku Jaafar who gave his commitment in the matter

    The decision received commendation from local advocacy group Family Frontiers and the Malaysian chapter of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR Malaysia), which agreed to amend the Federal Constitution so that children born abroad to Malaysian mothers can gain automatic Malaysian citizenship

    She also called for existing laws be made more holistic to address citizenship matters in relation to single citizenship

    "For example, Ali was born in the UK and will get citizenship

    The Court of Appeal, in a majority decision on August 5, saw two judges ruling that the overseas-born children of Malaysian mothers cannot automatically be Malaysian citizens

    ['government', 'decision', 'law', 'citizenship', 'malaysian']

    Lee said his ministry would work closely with the consul-general's offices of Brunei and Indonesia in Kuching on the matter

    He also pledged to bring it up in the Brunei-Indonesia-Malaysia-Philippines East Asean Growth Area (BIMP-EAGA) meeting

    On Feb 10, federal Transport Minister Anthony Loke announced that drivers no longer needed to carry a physical driving licence or display the road tax sticker on their vehicles

    He said they could instead apply for the digital version of their road tax and driving licences on the Road Transport Department's (JPJ) website or MyJPJ app

    “It is as if our education system had produced many university graduates who had very little thinking and analytical abilities,” he remarked

    Malaysian education, he added, needed a system that could cut down on unnecessary subjects, and to focus more on core subjects such as Science and Information Technology, as well as knowledge on innovation, creativity and productivity

    “Our future lies in the skills, knowledge and attitude of our young people

    A traditional IRA lets you grow your money tax-free until you make withdrawals in retirement

    With a Roth IRA, you’ll need to pay your taxes upfront but can benefit from tax-free withdrawals in retirement instead

    If you think you might be in a higher tax bracket in the future, consider taking on a lower tax burden now and gaining from tax-free withdrawals in your retirement

    Orta knew the end was approaching for Marsch, but the damage caused by the uncertainty over the new manager, and failure to find one, could be enough to consign Leeds to relegation

    Sacking Tuchel and replacing him with a relative novice in Potter were two hugely naive decisions by Boehly, but there will be no consequences for the Chelsea co-owner, just the chance to play fantasy football again by hiring another manager

    Sunday, 19 Feb 2023

    Items seized in the joint operation

    The transnational syndicate is believed to be involved in more than 360 reports

    The operation on Feb 10 was conducted by the Singapore Commercial Affairs Department (CAD) and Johor Commercial Crime Investigation Department (CCID) of the Royal Malaysia Police (RMP), and involved raids in Johor and Singapore

    Officers from CCID RMP conducted raids at three apartment complexes in Johor on Feb 10 in the joint operation, leading to the arrest of one woman and 11 men for their suspected involvement in the fake friend call scam targeting Singaporeans

    Chew also thanked Malaysian police and officers from the Johor CCID for their efforts in arresting transnational crime syndicates

    ['operation', 'syndicate', 'police', 'singapore', 'call']

  • TEN HAG SET TO BREAK MAN UTD RULE TO EXTEND DE GEA CONTRACT; LINES UP LEEDS STAR AS LONG-TERM REPLACEMENT

    https://www.teamtalk.com/manchester-united/ten-hag-set-to-break-man-utd-rule-to-extend-de-gea-contract-lines-up-leeds-star-as-long-term-replacement

    02/19/2023, 21:08

    57.14% Shortened!

    Premier League • England Manchester United are willing to stretch to a £250,000 per week wage to keep David de Gea at Old Trafford, according to reports.  But, Erik ten Hag is allegedly already looking at bringing in Leeds United shot-stopper Illan Meslier as his long-term replacement

    This new, reported offer is somewhat unexpected, given Ten Hag introduced a rule this season that no United player could earn more than £200,000 per week.  But, the fact that the Dutch coach is willing to compromise to keep De Gea at the club, shows how important he is to the team

    Now, according to the Sun, Ten Hag is willing to offer his goalkeeper £200,000 per week to keep him at Old Trafford for at least next season

    Despite De Gea clearly still being important to United, he is already 32 years old, so they are already thinking about a more long-term addition

    According to the Sun’s report, United are very interested in making a move for Leeds’ shot-stopper Meslier and are willing to wait until they can offer him a starting spot

    At just 22 years old, the keeper has the potential to get even better than he already is, so United will be hoping that they can seal a deal in the future

    ['league', 'united', 'willing', 'per', 'week']

  • GOVT DOESN'T WANT 'HUFFAZ' TO BE LEFT OUT OF NATIONAL EDUCATION SYSTEM, SAYS ZAHID

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/19/govt-doesnt-want-huffaz-to-be-left-out-of-national-education-system-says-zahid

    02/19/2023, 20:08

    64.71% Shortened!

    He said the initiative was in line with the government's goal of producing 125,000 huffaz professionals by 2050

    The Deputy Prime Minister said huffaz must have academic qualifications including the Sijil Pelajaran Malaysia (SPM), which is one of the requirements to join the public service

    The perception, he said, was not appropriate because the huffaz also needed to generate their own income for survival

    "We should not underestimate those who are in the field of religion, especially those who are in tahfiz centres, so much so they are marginalised from the national education system," he said

    Ahmad Zahid said he also appreciated the efforts of UPSI which aims to create an institution of Islamic education and studies specifically to provide opportunities to huffaz throughout the country

    Ahmad Zahid previously said the National Tahfiz Education Policy (DPTN) 2.0 would be launched on March 11, and that the government was studying the previous DPTN launched in 2016 to ensure there was coordination in terms of teaching methods in tahfiz institutions

    ['government', 'huffaz', 'also', 'national', 'education']

  • I WANT TO INVEST PASSIVELY. HOW CAN I CREATE A SET-IT-AND-FORGET-IT PORTFOLIO?

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/create-set-forget-portfolio-205334436.html

    86.05% Shortened!

    Here are four steps to creating a passively managed portfolio

    Discover The Guiding Principle Of Your Investment Portfolio The first step in creating a passively managed portfolio is to determine your investment philosophy and goals

    This will be the guiding principle for your portfolio and will inform your asset allocation, diversification strategy, and risk tolerance

    It's also a smart play to rebalance your portfolio and review your investments regularly

    Keep in mind when building a passively managed portfolio, you need to consider both the asset class and the specific investment

    Keep a Record Of Your Portfolio Management Strategy Finally, keep a record of your portfolio management strategy, including your investment philosophy, asset allocation, and the investments you hold

    ['invest', 'manage', 'portfolio', 'advisor', 'investment']

    Here are four steps to creating a passively managed portfolio

    Discover The Guiding Principle Of Your Investment Portfolio The first step in creating a passively managed portfolio is to determine your investment philosophy and goals

    This will be the guiding principle for your portfolio and will inform your asset allocation, diversification strategy, and risk tolerance

    It's also a smart play to rebalance your portfolio and review your investments regularly

    Keep in mind when building a passively managed portfolio, you need to consider both the asset class and the specific investment

    Keep a Record Of Your Portfolio Management Strategy Finally, keep a record of your portfolio management strategy, including your investment philosophy, asset allocation, and the investments you hold

    Hasnul also said that a Selangor assemblyman must attend a sitting in six months, even if it is only for a day

    "It is clearly stated in the enactment and regulations that you have to show up within a six-month period

    In addition, Harumaini also failed to show up for the tabling of the 2023 Selangor Budget last year

    On Feb 16, the Batang Kali state seat was declared vacant effective Jan 28 after the incumbent, Harumaini of Pejuang, had failed to show up for any sitting in a period of six months

    The declaration was carried out under the provision of Article LXIX of the Selangor State Constitution 1959

    02/19/2023, 18:09

    45.45% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise SEPANG, Feb 19 — Five stranded Malaysians in Thailand were rescued by Malaysian authorities after falling prey to job scams following a successful meeting with Malaysia authorities and Thailand counterparts earlier this week, Bukit Aman Crime Investigation Department’s director Datuk Seri Abd Jalil Hassan said today

    As of February 18, Abdul Jalil said Malaysian police have received a total of 267 police reports involving 339 victims who were reportedly stranded overseas after having been deceived by syndicates offering their high-paying salaried jobs

    In Thailand, Abdul Jalil said 19 Malaysians were identified as being in Thailand based on statistics and police reports made by families of employment fraud victims in Malaysia, including the five aforementioned rescued

    “During our delegation visit from February 16 to February 19, Thai authorities made a request for all information leading to the whereabouts of job scam victims to be channelled either to Wisma Putra (Foreign Ministry) or the Royal Malaysia Police (RMP)

    “Any information channelled through non-governmental organisations will not be entertained for fear of unverified information or jeopardising ongoing investigations

    “Therefore, I am also urging for any information, be it from next-of-kin or victims themselves, channel them to the RMP’s hotline at 03-26101510,” he told a press conference here at the Kuala Lumpur International Airport

    ['malaysian', 'thailand', 'rescue', 'authority', 'job']

    About Us Advertise SEPANG, Feb 19 — Five stranded Malaysians in Thailand were rescued by Malaysian authorities after falling prey to job scams following a successful meeting with Malaysia authorities and Thailand counterparts earlier this week, Bukit Aman Crime Investigation Department’s director Datuk Seri Abd Jalil Hassan said today

    As of February 18, Abdul Jalil said Malaysian police have received a total of 267 police reports involving 339 victims who were reportedly stranded overseas after having been deceived by syndicates offering their high-paying salaried jobs

    In Thailand, Abdul Jalil said 19 Malaysians were identified as being in Thailand based on statistics and police reports made by families of employment fraud victims in Malaysia, including the five aforementioned rescued

    “During our delegation visit from February 16 to February 19, Thai authorities made a request for all information leading to the whereabouts of job scam victims to be channelled either to Wisma Putra (Foreign Ministry) or the Royal Malaysia Police (RMP)

    “Any information channelled through non-governmental organisations will not be entertained for fear of unverified information or jeopardising ongoing investigations

    “Therefore, I am also urging for any information, be it from next-of-kin or victims themselves, channel them to the RMP’s hotline at 03-26101510,” he told a press conference here at the Kuala Lumpur International Airport

  • LYNAS PLANT MAY BE RETAINED IF NO RADIOACTIVE WASTE PRODUCED, SAYS MINISTER

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/19/lynas-plant-may-be-retained-if-no-radioactive-waste-produced-says-minister

    02/19/2023, 18:08

    50.0% Shortened!

    “If someone is willing to ship the ‘low-risk radioactive waste’ (as claimed) out of our country, the government can consider retaining the C&L plant in Gebeng,” Chang tweeted

    The operating licences of Lynas Malaysia were extended until March 2, 2026

    However, Chang said no C&L activities can be carried out in the Lynas Advanced Materials Plant in Gebeng after July this year

    Lynas has since criticised the decision and said it could result in hundreds of job losses

    After July 1 this year, Lynas is also not allowed to import and process rare earth concentrates.

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

  • 'WE ALMOST GOT CHEATED': WOMAN ACCUSES PERANAKAN RESTAURANT OF MISLEADING 'NO PORK' SIGN, DRAWS FLAK

    https://www.asiaone.com/singapore/we-almost-got-cheated-woman-accuses-peranakan-restaurant-misleading-no-pork-sign-draws

    02/19/2023

    60.0% Shortened!

    No pork lard or no pork, no lard? A confusing sign pasted outside a restaurant was what greeted one woman when she was looking around a mall for a Muslim-friendly place to dine

    TikTok user Lunanguyen.hb shared her bewilderment in a clip posted on Saturday (Feb 18), writing about how she and her dining companions "almost got cheated" by a sign at a Peranakan restaurant which she took to mean "no pork, no lard"

    However, a check on the menu showed that pork was listed among the ingredients

    No pork lard doesn't mean not selling pork." "It says 'no pork lard', not 'no pork no lard'

    The 'no pork no lard' is misleading," wrote one

    To some, this gave the misleading signal that the "no" covers both "pork" and "lard".  Other commenters noted that one should always check the menu first, and to always look out for the Halal certificate if in doubt

    ['pork', 'lard', 'sign', 'one', 'lunanguyen']

    No pork lard or no pork, no lard? A confusing sign pasted outside a restaurant was what greeted one woman when she was looking around a mall for a Muslim-friendly place to dine

    TikTok user Lunanguyen.hb shared her bewilderment in a clip posted on Saturday (Feb 18), writing about how she and her dining companions "almost got cheated" by a sign at a Peranakan restaurant which she took to mean "no pork, no lard"

    However, a check on the menu showed that pork was listed among the ingredients

    No pork lard doesn't mean not selling pork." "It says 'no pork lard', not 'no pork no lard'

    The 'no pork no lard' is misleading," wrote one

    To some, this gave the misleading signal that the "no" covers both "pork" and "lard".  Other commenters noted that one should always check the menu first, and to always look out for the Halal certificate if in doubt

    ['pork', 'lard', 'sign', 'one', 'lunanguyen']



  • IMMIGRATION RAIDS: 64 ILLEGALS, FOUR OFFICERS NABBED IN BINTULU

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/19/immigration-raids-64-illegals-four-officers-nabbed-in-bintulu

    02/19/2023, 17:09

    73.91% Shortened!

    Sunday, 19 Feb 2023

    Immigration director-general Datuk Seri Khairul Dzaimee Daud said the raid was conducted at 9.45pm on Friday (Feb 17) after a three-month surveillance

    "We detained a 38-year-old Indonesian man, believed to be the syndicate's leader, following a raid on a house used as a transit home

    "We also detained four Immigration officers for being in cahoots with the syndicate," he added

    The syndicate was arranging the entry of blacklisted foreigners with the aid of Immigration officers, he said

    Khairul Dzaimee said those with security stamps would then be brought to transit homes before being transported to the airports in Kuching, Miri and Bintulu

    ['indonesian', 'syndicate', 'immigration', 'officer', 'detain']

  • CONSTRUCTION OF PERAK SOCSO REHABILITATION CENTRE 11.8 PCT COMPLETE: SIVAKUMAR

    https://www.thesundaily.my/local/construction-of-perak-socso-rehabilitation-centre-118-pct-complete-sivakumar-HC10655075

    02/19/2023, 17:08

    45.45% Shortened!

    Sivakumar (pix) said the country’s second rehabilitation centre, costing RM654 million, is expected to be fully completed and operational by the end of 2024 and 400 qualified staff will be employed

    In addition, he said the rehabilitation centre would also serve as a sophisticated Centre of Excellence for the Rehabilitation and Return To Work Programme at the global level, thus making it the best national rehabilitation centre in the country, and largest neuro-robotic service centre in Southeast Asia

    Sivakumar also said that a total of 11,643 patients have undergone physical and vocational rehabilitation at the Tun Abdul Razak Rehabilitation Centre (PRPTAR) in Melaka since it started operating in 2014 until last January

    He said that on an average 30 to 35 per cent of the cases were from the states in the north of the peninsula, so with the rehabilitation centre in Perak, cases from the north could be referred there

    Asked if the rehabilitation centre will be built in other states as well, Sivakumar said the government was still mulling over it as it involves high costs

    Earlier, Sivakumar visited the workers temporary labour quarters (TLQ) for the Rehabilitation Centre in Ipoh and said he was satisfied with the facilities and equipment provided in the TLQ

    ['neuro', 'centre', 'sivakumar', 'say', 'rehabilitation']

  • LITHIUM MINER SIGMA JUMPS ON REPORT TESLA CONSIDERING BUYOUT

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/tesla-considering-bid-sigma-lithium-221747925.html

    50.0% Shortened!

    Tesla and Sigma Lithium did not immediately respond to Reuters requests for comment

    Sigma is finishing construction of a hard rock lithium mine in Brazil that it expects to open by April

    The mine will produce spodumene concentrate, which can be used to make lithium hydroxide, a type of the metal preferred by some automakers including Tesla and BMW

    stock of Sigma Lithium, which has a market capitalization of $3.21 billion, nearly trebled in value last year

    Last month, Tesla signed an agreement with Piedmont Lithium Inc for supply of spodumene concentrate from Quebec, starting later this year

    Tesla also has supply contracts for nickel, lithium and a range of other EV metals from suppliers across the globe

    ['sigma', 'lithium', 'tesla', 'metal', 'mining']

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/19/turkiye-syria-quake-pm-anwar-touched-by-malaysians039-concern-contributions

    02/19/2023, 16:09

    53.85% Shortened!

    Sunday, 19 Feb 2023

    According to him, the aid to Damascus, Syria was sent via two A400M aircraft of the Royal Malaysian Air Force (RMAF) which is the result of the cooperation by the government, non-governmental organisations and people

    "I pray the humanitarian assistance mission to Syria by a team of Malaysian volunteers would be blessed,” he said in a Facebook post on Sunday (Feb 19)

    The humanitarian aid delivery mission, the first to Syria since the country and Turkiye were hit by an earthquake on Feb 6 left at about 10.15 pm last night from Subang RMAF base with 51 crew including representatives of ministries and NGOs

    The death toll of the earthquake measuring 7.8 on the Richter scale which shook south Turkiye and northwest Syria has exceeded 45,000 victims

    Meanwhile, according to the Prime Minister in an interview with Turkiye Radio and Television Department (TRT) in Ankara during his visit to the country on Wednesday, Malaysia had sent three humanitarian assistance mission teams to the country so far

    He was charged under Section 471 of the Penal Code punishable under Section 465 of the same code which provides for a maximum prison sentence of two years or a fine or both

  • RED TIDE ALERT: LABUAN RESIDENTS ADVISED TO AVOID EATING SHELLFISH

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/19/red-tide-alert-labuan-residents-advised-to-avoid-eating-shellfish/55681

    02/19/2023, 15:08

    60.0% Shortened!

    Its director Faizal Ibrahim Suhaili said this follows the detection of the red tide phenomenon near Sepanggar waters

    “As the Sabah Department of Fisheries (DoF) has issued a warning of red tide, this applies in Labuan as well, as Labuan waters is linked to Sabah waters,” he told Bernama today

    Faizal Ibrahim said paralytic shellfish poisoning is a syndrome that people could develop if they eat seafood contaminated by red tide

    “Red tide blooms can last days, weeks, or months and can also change daily due to wind conditions and water currents..

    Sabah Department of Fisheries has warned the public against consuming shellfish from Kota Kinabalu and Tuaran waters after a red tide was detected near Sepanggar Island on Friday

    Labuan in April 2015 had reported two cases (involving two local fishermen from Kg Sg Miri) of paralytic shellfish poisoning following the red tide phenomenon in the waters off the island

    ['labuan', 'shellfish', 'sabah', 'say', 'red']

  • COPS SEIZE DRUGS WORTH RM2MIL IN KLUANG RAIDS, ONE SUSPECT ARRESTED

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/19/cops-seize-drugs-worth-rm2mil-in-kluang-raids-one-suspect-arrested

    02/19/2023, 14:08

    68.42% Shortened!

    Sunday, 19 Feb 2023

    Johor deputy police chief Deputy Comm M

    Kumar said police launched a special operation at four separate locations in Kluang at around 1.30pm on Thursday (Feb 16)

    "Following the first raid, we found over RM2mil worth of drugs in a rented house and arrested a 27-year-old local man

    He noted that police seized 35.74kg of ecstasy powder worth RM1.787mil, 2.52kg of ketamine worth RM138,600, 3.24kg of Erimin 5 pills worth RM162,000, and 1.67kg of ecstasy pills worth RM73,035 from the first house

    "Also seized from the first house were four cars worth RM155,000," he added

    Jo Ghani said the government’s role is to focus on running the government and to collect the tax

    At the moment, the government aims to complete the review of DNB by end of March 2023

    They have been calls to liberalise the deployment of 5G in Malaysia to speed up deployment

    Since DNB’s 5G spectrum is awarded based on Apparatus Assignment (AA) instead of Spectrum Assignment (SA), he said the government has some flexibility to rethink its 5G deployment strategy

  • PARTI DAYAK PRESIDENT URGES FEDERAL GOVT TO GIVE SARAWAK FULL AUTONOMY TO GRANT CITIZENSHIP TO INDIVIDUALS BORN IN THE STATE

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/19/parti-dayak-president-urges-federal-govt-to-give-sarawak-full-autonomy-to-grant-citizenship-to-individuals-born-in-thestate/55675

    02/19/2023, 13:08

    50.0% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUCHING, Feb 19 — Parti Bansa Dayak Sarawak (PBDS) president Bobby William today urged the federal government to also include the status of stateless individuals in the amendment to the Malaysian Constitution to enable them to become citizens

    “The citizenship issue has long been outstanding that has haunted many Sarawakians, especially the natives,” Bobby said when asked to respond to the federal government’s decision to amend the Federal Constitution to enable children born abroad to Malaysian mothers to gain automatic Malaysian citizenship

    He urged Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Fadillah Yusof to fight for these Sarawakians, who are without citizenship certification, in the federal Cabinet

    He said he welcomes the federal government’s decision to amend the constitution to enable children born overseas to Malaysian mothers to be granted automatic citizenship

    In a joint statement yesterday, the Home and Law and Institutional Reform Ministries said the federal Cabinet has agreed to amend the Federal Constitution to enable children born abroad to Malaysian mothers to gain automatic Malaysian citizenshipHome Minister Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail and Law and Institutional Reform Minister Datuk Seri Azalina Othman Said added that the amendment is expected to be tabled in the current Dewan Rakyat sitting

    They said the Cabinet had agreed last Friday in its meeting to the proposal to amend the Federal Constitution, in particular, Section 1(1)(d) and Section 1(1)(e) of Part I in the Second Schedule, and Section 1(b) and Section 1(c) in Part II of the same schedule

    ['federal', 'malaysian', 'constitution', 'say', 'citizenship']

    About Us Advertise KUCHING, Feb 19 — Parti Bansa Dayak Sarawak (PBDS) president Bobby William today urged the federal government to also include the status of stateless individuals in the amendment to the Malaysian Constitution to enable them to become citizens

    “The citizenship issue has long been outstanding that has haunted many Sarawakians, especially the natives,” Bobby said when asked to respond to the federal government’s decision to amend the Federal Constitution to enable children born abroad to Malaysian mothers to gain automatic Malaysian citizenship

    81.25% Shortened!

    Elliott is not bidding for the club itself, the person said

    "The bid plans to return the club to its former glories both on and off the pitch, and - above all - will seek to place the fans at the heart of Manchester United Football Club once more,” Sheikh Jassim wrote in the statement

    On Saturday, British billionaire Jim Ratcliffe, a Manchester United fan who’s already lined up financing from banks including Goldman Sachs Group Inc., and his company Ineos Group also said they had submitted a bid for majority ownership of the club

    Promising to put "the Manchester back into Manchester United,” Ratcliffe and Ineos said they would focus on winning the Champions League

    A deal for Manchester United could represent the biggest takeover of a professional sports club on record, potentially surpassing the $4.65 billion paid last year by a group led by Walmart Inc

    If successful, Sheikh Jassim’s group might have to persuade UEFA that it is sufficiently independent from QSI for PSG and Manchester United to play in the same European competition

  • RUSSIA TO PRESS ITS SU-57 FIGHTERS FOR BIG ONSLAUGHT ON UKRAINE; COULD BE USED FOR TYPICAL STEALTH MISSIONS

    https://eurasiantimes.com/russia-to-press-its-su-57-fighters-for-big-onslaught-on-ukraine-could-be-used-for-typical-stealth-missions/

    02/19/2023, 12:08

    70.0% Shortened!

    Being its most advanced fighter, Russia is unlikely to fly it within Ukrainian airspace, where it might become a target for Western surface-to-air missile (SAM) systems

    These are the National Advanced Surface-to-Air Missile System (NASAMS), the German IRIS-T, and powerful Soviet-origin S-300 and Buk defense systems

    This is particularly true given the fact that the war has been less characterized by airpower, featuring heavy air-to-air combat, regular bombing, and air dominance operations

    Russia’s Su-35S, Su-30SM2, and MiG-35 are not only sufficient for the little air superiority and combat air patrol (CAP) missions but also to take on Western jets like the Eurofighter Typhoon, F-16, F-15, and possibly the F-35

    It has two large internal weapon bays mounted in tandem between the engines and two side bays for short-range air-to-air missiles

    The ten internal and six external hardpoints can carry R-74M Archer and R-77M Adder air-to-air missile (AAM); Kh-38M air-to-surface missiles; Kh-31AD and Kh-35U anti-ship missiles and; Kh-31PD and Kh-58UShK anti-radiation missiles

    ['russia', 'fighter', 'air', 'use', 'defense']

  • CYCLONE DEATH TOLL IN NEW ZEALAND RISES TO 11 AS RECOVERY CONTINUES

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/world/2023/02/19/cyclone-death-toll-in-new-zealand-rises-to-11-as-recovery-continues/55661

    02/19/2023, 11:08

    50.0% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise SYDNEY, Feb 19 — The death toll from Cyclone Gabrielle in New Zealand climbed to 11 today as thousands of people remained missing a week after the storm struck the country’s North Island

    The cyclone hit the North Island’s uppermost region on February 12 and tracked down the east coast, inflicting widespread devastation

    Today, police said two more people had died in the hard-hit Hawke’s Bay area in circumstances related to the cyclone, raising the death toll to 11

    Some 5,608 people remained uncontactable across the country, while 1,196 had registered they were safe, police said

    Of those, almost 40,000 were in Hawke’s Bay, out of a population of about 170,000

    Prime Minister Hipkins has said the crisis response is “still underway” and that people across the North Island are “working around the clock.” Police have sent an extra 100 officers to Hawke’s Bay and nearby Tairawhiti, including to isolated areas, and the New Zealand Herald reported roadblocks around a rural Hawke’s Bay village to deter looters

    ['cyclone', 'people', 'police', 'say', 'hawke']

    About Us Advertise SYDNEY, Feb 19 — The death toll from Cyclone Gabrielle in New Zealand climbed to 11 today as thousands of people remained missing a week after the storm struck the country’s North Island

    The cyclone hit the North Island’s uppermost region on February 12 and tracked down the east coast, inflicting widespread devastation

    Today, police said two more people had died in the hard-hit Hawke’s Bay area in circumstances related to the cyclone, raising the death toll to 11

    Some 5,608 people remained uncontactable across the country, while 1,196 had registered they were safe, police said

    Of those, almost 40,000 were in Hawke’s Bay, out of a population of about 170,000

    Prime Minister Hipkins has said the crisis response is “still underway” and that people across the North Island are “working around the clock.” Police have sent an extra 100 officers to Hawke’s Bay and nearby Tairawhiti, including to isolated areas, and the New Zealand Herald reported roadblocks around a rural Hawke’s Bay village to deter looters

    ['cyclone', 'people', 'police', 'say', 'hawke']



  • NEW ZEALAND'S CYCLONE DEATH TOLL RISES TO 11, THOUSANDS STILL MISSING

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/world/new-zealand-death-toll-cyclone-gabrielle-recovery-continues-north-island-3289231

    02/19/2023, 10:09

    68.42% Shortened!

    The cyclone hit the North Island's uppermost region on Feb 12 and tracked down the east coast, inflicting widespread devastation

    Prime Minister Chris Hipkins has called Gabrielle New Zealand's biggest natural disaster this century

    On Sunday, police said two more people had died in the hard-hit Hawke's Bay area in circumstances related to the cyclone, raising the death toll to 11

    A team from Fiji will leave for New Zealand in the coming days to assist with recovery, one of 12 offers of international aid received so far, Hipkins said

    “The police are working to maintain law and order," Hipkins said.

    By clicking subscribe, I agree to receive news updates and promotional material from Mediacorp and Mediacorp's partners.

    ['cyclone', 'new', 'zealand', 'hipkins', 'say']

    The cyclone hit the North Island's uppermost region on Feb 12 and tracked down the east coast, inflicting widespread devastation

    Prime Minister Chris Hipkins has called Gabrielle New Zealand's biggest natural disaster this century

    On Sunday, police said two more people had died in the hard-hit Hawke's Bay area in circumstances related to the cyclone, raising the death toll to 11

    A team from Fiji will leave for New Zealand in the coming days to assist with recovery, one of 12 offers of international aid received so far, Hipkins said

    “The police are working to maintain law and order," Hipkins said.

  • EARTHQUAKE: MALAYSIA SENDS FIRST HUMANITARIAN AID MISSION TO SYRIA

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/19/earthquake-malaysia-sends-first-humanitarian-aid-mission-to-syria

    02/19/2023, 10:09

    68.42% Shortened!

    Sunday, 19 Feb 2023

    SUBANG, 18 Feb -- Chief of Royal Malaysian Air Force (RMAF) Datuk Seri Mohd Asghar Khan Goriman Khan poses for a photo while attending the earthquake humanitarian aid delivery mission to Syria at the RMAF Subang Air Base on Saturday.

    The statement also thanked all Malaysians who responded to the call to lend aid to the earthquake victims in Syria

    "Among the NGOs that have also made this mission a success are the Malaysian Red Crescent Society, Mercy Malaysia, BeVital Ihsan Johor, RED A Humanitarian, Malaysia For Syria, Wisma Putra Global Peace Mission, MAHAR, MCRD, Shine Catholic Church, Yemeni School Foundation and Syrian People Malaysia," read statement

    Meanwhile, a journalist from the Malaysian National News Agency (Bernama), Siti Zanariah Nor Zin, also joined the aid mission team to provide coverage from Syria

    A 7.8-magnitude earthquake that hit southern Turkey and northwestern Syria on Feb 6 has claimed thousands of lives.- Bernama

    ['feb', 'malaysian', 'earthquake', 'humanitarian', 'aid']

  • KIT SIANG: SETTLEMENT OF APANDI’S SUIT AGAINST DR MAHATHIR MUST BE MADE PUBLIC

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/19/kit-siang-settlement-of-apandis-suit-against-dr-mahathir-must-be-made-public/55651

    02/19/2023, 10:08

    45.45% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 19 — DAP veteran Lim Kit Siang today said that keeping the settlement terms of former Attorney General Tan Sri Mohamad Apandi Ali’s lawsuit against Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad private goes against the public interest

    He said public interest required all terms be made public and it was indefensible to keep it a secret as Apandi had already stated the amount he was seeking for his dismissal which was RM2.23 million

    He called on the government to review and reverse its decision

    “Public interest requires the out-of-court settlement to be made public

    The Cabinet should reverse the decision to keep the out of court settlement from the knowledge of the public, as the government is acting on behalf of the public,” Lim said in a statement this morning

    Azalina said that Apandi’s lawyers and the Attorney-General’s Chambers had agreed during the negotiations for settlement that the settlement terms would be kept confidential and not disclosed to the public

    ['say', 'keep', 'settlement', 'term', 'apandi']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 19 — DAP veteran Lim Kit Siang today said that keeping the settlement terms of former Attorney General Tan Sri Mohamad Apandi Ali’s lawsuit against Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad private goes against the public interest

    He said public interest required all terms be made public and it was indefensible to keep it a secret as Apandi had already stated the amount he was seeking for his dismissal which was RM2.23 million

    He called on the government to review and reverse its decision

    The Cabinet should reverse the decision to keep the out of court settlement from the knowledge of the public, as the government is acting on behalf of the public,” Lim said in a statement this morning
